question: I am a 29 yo female. I had a baby 8/97 by c-section 12 weeks premature, because I had preeclampsia and HEELP syndrome.  A week after delivery I almost dies with 2 pulmonary embolisms.  Three months after that, I began nasua vomiting diareah, and rt upper pain.  Some test were done (blood) and found me thyroid was way way off hypothyroidism.  The pain and what I call attacks continued. I had ct done for poss gallstones, what showed up was an extremly fatty liver, with no answer why. In May I had a severe attack so bad I needed 2 blood transfusions, after colonoscopy and biopsy dr were stuned to find out it was Ischemic colitis, they dont have any clue where it came from.  It did clear up for a couple of months then returned again though not as severe I am still having intermitant pain diahrea vomit and nasua, I went to another dr, had another ct to show liver still the same. It is a mystery to what is causing this, I am not overweight, I do not drink, Could there be a problem no one has picked up on. I am really tired of feelining sick and tired of bein woke up at all hours with pain. I also follow a strict diet even though they feel there is no relation. I also feel my skin looks yellow alot of times and when I get sick I vomit yellow fluids. Please help, direct me to the right place Thankyou .. cindy_____________Dear Cindy,I suggest that you arrange follow-up with a hepatologist to determine the cause of your fatty liver.  This physician can coordinate the inestigation of your other health problems.  If you are in the SE Mchigan area, we would be happy tp see you in the Division of Gastroenterology/Hepatology of the Henry Ford Health System.  You can arrange an appoinment by calling our Division Ofices at (313)876-2408 and requesting an appoinment with either Dr. Brown or Dr. Moonka, our hepatologists.This information is presented for educational purposes only.  Ask specific questions to your personal physician.HFHSM.D.-rf
title: Many things wrong, unsure why?
